revised_title: Graph-Theoretical Aspects of Ring Current Calculations in Conjugated Systems
tldr: This article explores the graph-theoretical aspects of simple ring current calculations in conjugated systems. It examines the relationship between the adjacency matrix of the graph representing the -bond skeleton of a conjugated system and the secular equations arising in the theory. The article emphasizes the importance of graph-theoretical ideas, such as circuits and spanning trees, in understanding ring currents and highlights the significance of determining whether a molecular graph is semi-Hamiltonian or non-Hamiltonian.
